album.description: Images of the sky: planetary or lunar conjunctions, occultations, constellations, aurorae, star trails, and more!
album.title: The Sky

objects.creator: JCP
objects.thumbCaption:
"Supermoon" rising at ONU.
The full moon rising over the ONU campus, during the March 19, 2011 "supermoon". This happens when the full moon occurs at perigee, and the Moon is closest to…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title "Supermoon" rising at ONU.

Description The full moon rising over the ONU campus, during the March 19, 2011 "supermoon". This happens when the full moon occurs at perigee, and the Moon is closest to the Earth in its orbit. The March 19 supermoon appeared almost 20% brighter and 15% larger than the average full moon. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT.

Original Date 3/19/11, 7:30 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 71mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 800

Exposure Time 20.0s

Aperture ƒ/11.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Aperture priority

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1728 x 1152
objects.title: "Supermoon" rising at ONU.
objects.imageCaption:
"Supermoon" rising at ONU.
The full moon rising over the ONU campus, during the March 19, 2011 "supermoon". This happens when the full moon occurs at perigee, and the Moon is closest to the Earth in its orbit. The March 19 supermoon appeared almost 20% brighter and 15% larger than the average full moon. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT.

objects.comment: The full moon rising over the ONU campus, during the March 19, 2011 "supermoon". This happens when the full moon occurs at perigee, and the Moon is closest to the Earth in its orbit. The March 19 supermoon appeared almost 20% brighter and 15% larger than the average full moon. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT.

Creator JCP

Title Green auroral "curtains" with the Big Dipper.

Description Green auroral curtains seen with Big Dipper in the back ground. Red aurora is seen at higher altitudes corresponding to charged solar wind particles streaming down on our location. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT. During the great display of 10/24/11.

objects.creator: JCP
objects.thumbCaption:
Orion above the ONU Observatory.
The constellation Orion, with the corner of the ONU Observatory helpfully pointing to the bright blue star Rigel. Also visible are Orion's belt of three stars,…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Orion above the ONU Observatory.

Description The constellation Orion, with the corner of the ONU Observatory helpfully pointing to the bright blue star Rigel. Also visible are Orion's belt of three stars, in the center; Betelgeuse, a red supergiant in the center top of the photo; Sirius, the bright star on the left in Canis Major; the Orion Nebula, visible as a group of stars making up Orion's "sword" under his belt; and Taurus, a constellation shaped like a V and marked by the bright orange star Aldebaran on the right. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT.

Original Date 3/10/12, 8:58 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 29mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 200

Exposure Time 20.0s

Aperture ƒ/5.6

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1920 x 1280
objects.title: Orion above the ONU Observatory.
objects.imageCaption:
Orion above the ONU Observatory.
The constellation Orion, with the corner of the ONU Observatory helpfully pointing to the bright blue star Rigel. Also visible are Orion's belt of three stars, in the center; Betelgeuse, a red supergiant in the center top of the photo; Sirius, the bright star on the left in Canis Major; the Orion Nebula, visible as a group of stars making up Orion's "sword" under his belt; and Taurus, a constellation shaped like a V and marked by the bright orange star Aldebaran on the right. Taken with Canon Digital Rebel XT.

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Cirrus and sun Dog with the 12-inch telescope.

Description The cirrus cloud above the 12-inch looks a lot like a flying bird! To the right of the 12-inch is a sun dog or parhelion. Images of uniform light sources, like the sky, bring out the dust on the optics (grey circles).

Original Date 4/2/18, 4:19 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS DIGITAL REBEL XT

Focal Length (35mm) 29mm

Metering Mode Multi-segment

ISO Equivalent 200

Exposure Time 1/500s

Aperture ƒ/16.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Program normal

White balance Auto white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1920 x 1280

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Deneb and Cygnus the Swan.

Description Deneb and Cygnus the Swan. The star Deneb (center) is at the tail of the swan, but the top of the Northern Cross asterism. Below Deneb is NGC 7000, the North American Nebula (an emission nebula shaped like North America). Deep (347 sec) exposure taken by piggybacking the Canon T5i on the Meade 12".

Original Date 7/18/20, 10:37 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS REBEL T5i

Lens Model EF-S18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS STM

Focal Length 44 mm

Metering Mode Center weighted average

ISO Equivalent 1600

Exposure Time 347.4s

Aperture ƒ/7.0

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Manual white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1920 x 1280

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Conjunction of Saturn and Jupiter - with labels.

Description Conjunction of Saturn and Jupiter on Dec 20, 2020. Just before the closest approach, Saturn and Jupiter were about 8 arcminutes apart. This exposure was just long enough to reveal the Galilean moons around Jupiter without overexposing Jupiter. 1.6 sec, ISO 400 with the Canon T5i on Celestron 11-inch.

Title Meteor (Herculid) in Hercules.

Description Meteor (Herculid) in Hercules. 392 sec exposure with the Canon T5i piggybacking on the Meade 12-inch. Many star clouds and dust lanes in the Milky Way are visible in this long exposure. The meteor seems to be orangish in color. Vega is the bright star left of center.

name: Sky1
comment: Images of the sky: planetary or lunar conjunctions, occultations, constellations, aurorae, star trails, and more!
title: The Sky
